channel.title: Your Gaming Accomplishments
channel.description:
i'll admit, i'm not rich and i never have been; nor my parents. When i got a videogame for Christmas or my birthday, it was a big freak'n deal. New games were a rare thing to have in our home, so when those rainy days came, i had to make my games LAST. Before games came integrated trophies, achievements and the like, oldschool gamers like us had to come up with their OWN challenges to keep repetitive play-thrus interesting and fun.
( Well, maybe not always "fun", but certainly interesting. )
Back in the NES days, i prided myself in taking on tough challenges like playing through Mario3 with no 'shrooms or power-up items but it wasn't challenging enough. So i fought my way through the original Zelda with no sword. Turns out, everybody's already done that challenge, so i decided to take it one step further. i wanted to play through the HARDEST Zelda game, The Adventure of Link, using ONLY the items necessary to complete the game. No shield, life or fire spells. (the rest are required to finish the game) No items, except those absolutely necessary, (no cross, no magic key and NO CANDLE). i rejected every level-up screen except magic (required to enter the final dungeon) and obtained NO HEARTS.
So far i've finished every Zelda game on minimalist rules (3 hearts, no death, etc.) but The Adventure of Link was by far my biggest accomplishment.
After Zelda2, i went on to complete [url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=82W2RYqEspQ']Faxanadu[/url] minimalist (no armor, no sword, no items, etc.) and finished Half-Life with crowbar only (unless absolutely required). i've finished Half-Life2 and episodes with crowbar only and grav-gun only rules. i finished Metal Gear Solid 1, 2 and 3 on the hardest difficulty setting without being spotted and using only dart guns. Turns out Grand Theft Auto3 is a LOT harder if you play through the entire game with the same car you start with, don't kill any innocents and commit as few crimes as possible. GTA4 is even HARDER with the same rules, especially because Roman's car sometimes disappears between cutscenes!
So what accomplishments have you acquired? Anything worth bragging about or have you a challenge to share with others?
-Kawai Tei-

item.title: Your Gaming Accomplishments
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
I beat Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time in 5 hours 30 minutes once. Straight shot all the way through in one night. I remember this quite clearly because I had been sipping a milkshake throughout the first half but then when I brought the lights back up after the credits rolled my room had been invaded by ants.

Read full topic

item.title: Your Gaming Accomplishments
item.dc:creator: ManlyStump
item.description:
I’ve never been very good at games, so I was assuming I’d never have done anything worth mentioning in here, but then I remembered back when I played Wii Sports. I got so many 300’s in bowling that my rating was literally off the chart!

Read full topic

item.title: Your Gaming Accomplishments
item.dc:creator: Tei
item.description:
in the original Unreal Tournament, i had a record of 55 monster kills against 10 God-Likes. The constant “M-M-M-MON-MON-MO-M-MON-MON…!” for a solid minute was what made my mom burst into my room. She told me to turn the volume down. Once i moved my hand from the mouse to the volume knob, i got fragged and lost the record.

i had an awesome mutator that kept track of everything including jumps, dodges and distance traveled, plus double, multi and monster kills.

-Kawai Tei-

Read full topic

item.title: Your Gaming Accomplishments
item.dc:creator: Twinsen
item.description:
I have finished some times 4, 11 , 6 , 1 and 1 times ,more or less, respectively, Half-life, Half-life: Blue shift , Half-life:Opposing Force,
Half-life 2 (In hard) and Portal too, without dying not even once. And I am proud of it. XD

Read full topic

item.title: Your Gaming Accomplishments
item.dc:creator: Mr.Niceguy976
item.description:
I got 100% in GTA IV and L.A. Noire
I played all Halo games on Legendary
I played both Dead Spaces on Impossible and Hard Core (respectably) without dying
I am max rank in NFS: Hot Pursuit
I have 255 TF2 achievements

I love my games

Edit: Oh yes, I also had a level 80 rogue in WoW- before my account got banhammered. <_>

Read full topic

item.title: Your Gaming Accomplishments
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
I got 100% in Vice City and GTA IV. I tried to get 100% on San Andreas, but there is just so much to do, and I can’t finish the story again. As in, I hated it and can’t bring myself to finish it. I may give it another shot in the future though.

Read full topic

item.title: Your Gaming Accomplishments
item.dc:creator: dinnsfire5
item.description:
3 friends and I have been working on a “Left 4 Dead - No Mercy - Expert - All Survival - Speedrun” So far we’re at about 19 minutes.

I did the 3 day Majora’s Mask Challenge. Meaning you have to complete all of the dungeons of Majora’s Mask in the second 3 day cycle. (Meaning after the one when your stuck as a Deku.)

I also beat Portal 2’s single player, and multiplayer, and got all of the achievements within 48 hours of its release.

Read full topic

100% GTA: San Andreas and Vice City as well

item.title: Your Gaming Accomplishments
item.dc:creator: P0lop1e
item.description:
Lots of people must have done that, but i completed Portal without the funnel (Chamber 18 took ages, i still don’t know how i did it)
Wasn’t able to do the above on Portal 2 (you can’t remove the funnel option) so i decided to get all the achievements, and was successful.
Was also quite proud when i managed to workout how to change the skins on L4D/L4D2. So none of the survivors have their original skins now.
And as most people here, completed the HL series!

Read full topic
